p: In 2020, a series of cases [113–116] were brought by US states against oil companies, using arguments similar to those used to curtail the tobacco industry for its devastating impact on public health [117]. In an ongoing case, Washington DC (AC Racine v Exxon/BP/Shell/Chevron) [118], the defendants are accused of “systematically and intentionally misleading the public about the central role their products play in causing climate change, one of the greatest threats facing humanity”, including through coordinating campaigns of disinformation.
